snippet: Consumers in the United States borrowed more heavily for auto and student loans in October, taking on debt to help them find jobs and commute to work.
abstract: Federal Reserve reports consumer borrowing in United States rose $16 billion in October to $3.5 trillion; almost all of gain came from auto and student loans.
lead_paragraph: Consumers in the United States borrowed more heavily for auto and student loans in October, taking on debt to help them find jobs and commute to work.

headline.main: Vehicle and Education Loans in U.S. Increased in October
headline.print_headline: Vehicle and Education Loans in U.S. Increased in October
